page.title: 03TATSFIELD LEGENDS
page.content: The grasshopper is the badge of Tatsfield School.Sir Thomas Gresham,who built the Royal Exchange in London in 1570,was the son of a poor woman who, when he was a baby,abandoned him in a field.However the chirping of a grasshopper attracted a boy to where he lay,thus saving his life.When he became a rich merchant he chose a grasshopper for his crest.There is now a large gilt grasshopper on top of the Royal Exchange building.The Gunpowder Plot of Nov.5th. 1605 was foiled when one of his conspirators warned his M.P.friend. It is said that between 5p.m. and 6p.m. on Nov.5th the horse of this conspirator can be heard passing Church Corner, Tatsfield on its flight from London.
